column4: I've got some partition problems, could anyone please help me?
No matter what i do, i can't partition my hd. I've tried everything, and no matter what program i use, it won't let me.
have you used the gparted live CD?
i've used the cd, it said that the max size and the min size of the parttion was the same as my current size, so i can't do anything
like [admin] said, run sudo fdisk -l and post a link to the pastebin
I'm not very good at this stuff, so i don't know what that means. Could you please explain?
go to Applications --> Accessories --> Terminal, write "sudo fdisk -l" (without the quotations), copy and paste the output to pastebin.ubuntu.com and post the link you get here
I see. Then right-click My Computer, click Manage, go to Disk management, make a screenshot and paste it somewhere so we can see how your drives are partitioned
the picture?
anywhere.
I'm Swedish so I think I'll manage
you know there are thousands of sites where you can upload pictures, try http://imageshack.us/ for example.
what happens if you right-click the C: partition and choose "Shrink partition" (or whatever it says in Danish)?
that's probably because it's the system partition. Have you tried the Gparted live CD?
yes, it says i can shrink it 0mb, and so does all the other tools i've tried, including the console
you sure? I don't understand why Gparted wouldn't let you shrink your partition
that's really weird
i know, everyone i've asked has been stumped
and you're absolutely sure you've been trying to resize the actual C: partition and not the first 700 MB rescue partition you have?
yes, i'm completely sure, i can send you a screenshot of my trying to resize
no need, I believe you
